Eight policemen were killed in a Taliban attack on a checkpoint in the Sholgara District of the northern Balkh Province. The Taliban was blamed for the attack.

Eight policemen were killed and 7 others were wounded when the Taliban stormed their checkposts in Balkh's Dawlatabad District. The attack began when the Taliban stormed checkposts in the district, killing 1 and injuring two. Reinforcements of policemen sent to the area were later ambushed and 7 were killed with 5 wounded. The Taliban also had casualties in the attack, but the number was not confirmed.
A rigged motorbike exploded in the town of Qabasin, resulting in injuries.

Three civilians including two children were injured when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded near a bus terminal at the Mall Road area in Chaman. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.
Taliban attacked the market of Yangi Qala District. The police spokesman of the province said seven were injured and two killed, while a local official said three were killed.
Taliban attacked a government checkpoint in Imam Sahib District, killing ten and injuring around the same number according to the governor.

Defense Forces soldiers were injured in a ramming attack near Kafr Nima Two Palestinian attackers were killed and another injured IDF announced that the investigation had shown it was a terror attack and they had firebombed an intersection earlier

As part of Islamic State's revenge attacks and threats, an SDF member was assassinated by unidentified men on a motorbike in Swidan Jazira area. A number of SDF were injured when an IED exploded in their vehicle in Jammah. Two former IS members who were kidnapped from village of Hawija few days ago were found burnt along the Deir Ezzor–Hasaka road.

A Wolesi Jirga candidate was killed when a magnetic bomb exploded in his vehicle in the city of Kandahar. Also in Kandahar, a border police commander and his bodyguard were killed in a targeted attack. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attacks.

Two guards were injured when a radicalized prisoner stabbed them with a ceramic knife when he was with his wife in Condé-sur-Sarthe. The attacker and his wife then barricaded in at the family unit; afterwards, the police stormed the place and killed the woman and injured the attacker, who was identified as Michael Chiolo.
Eight civilians were injured when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded in a busy street in the town of Al-Bab.

A Cano Limon pipeline was damaged when a bomb exploded in the municipality of Saravena. The pipeline was not pumping at the time of the attack and the oil that spilled was contained and left behind by the explosion. A military source said that ELN rebels were to blame for the attack, which is the 10th bombing on the pipeline this year.

Four parcel bombs were sent to Waterloo railway station, Heathrow Airport, London City Airport and University of Glasgow. No one got injured by the packages. One bomb created a small fire after opening. The missing fifth bomb was found at 22 March at an Irish post office. An Irish republican dissident group known as the new IRA has claimed responsibility.

A suicide bomber attacked a building company near the Jalalabad Airport. Later, four militants attacked the area killing, 16 people and wounding 10. All five attackers were killed. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A bomb struck policemen in al-Tawakol village located in north of Miqdadiyah town. One policeman was killed and three others injured. The Islamic State group is suspected for the attack.
A knifeman tried to stab a group of police officers in Port Olimpic, a touristic zone of Barcelona. The attacker shouted "Allahu Akbar" when he was neutralized and being detained by the police.

Ten security personnel, including two soldiers were killed and 12 others were injured when the Taliban stormed their checkpoints in the Qalay-I-Zal District of Kunduz. After taking over the checkpoints, the Taliban were pushed back. There was no information about the casualties of the Taliban during the attack.
Seven members of the pro-government militia of Popular Mobilization Forces were killed and 30 others were injured when Islamic State militants ambushed them in the area of Makhmur.
Five farmers were killed and 20 injured when a mine planted by ISWAP exploded near their truck outside the town of Addamari/Khaddamari area in Borno State.

Eleven people were killed and 95 others wounded in a mortar shelling attack at a gathering commemorating the death anniversary of Shia leader Abdul Ali Mazari. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack. Two attackers were killed and another one was arrested by the police.

Two people were killed including a teenager and 32 others were wounded when a grenade was thrown and exploded at a bus stand in the city of Jammu. A suspect was arrested and the police blamed Hizbul Mujahideen for the attack.
Five people were killed and nine others were injured when a car bomb detonated outside a restaurant frequented by government soldiers. The Al-Shabaab group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Three soldiers were killed by militants when the soldiers were guarding the construction of a major highway in the Nduga Regency. A rebel was also killed in the attack, although reports say that more rebels were killed in the shootout. The attackers had also used traditional weapons like bows and spears.
Five soldiers were injured when they were attacked with explosives in the municipality of Fortul. The attack was blamed on an ELN front.
A policeman was killed when an sniper shot at him in the Yousef al-Haylan village in the province of Diyala. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for this incident.

A policeman was killed and 5 other people were left injured when gunmen opened fire on a police patrol in KhorMaksar district of Aden. No group claimed responsibility but the security source blamed it on extremist groups.
A SDF member was killed in the town of Abu Hardub. The Islamic Sate was blamed.

Militants driving a pick-up truck disguised in electricians' work clothes opened fire on a checkpoint of security forces in the southern part of the city. One police officer was wounded, and three attackers were killed. The militants were planning to plant a bomb in Giza.The government said the militants were part of the Hasm Movement.
Two SDF members were  killed in the town of Abu Hardub. The Islamic Sate was blamed and the attackers were heard shouting “Allahu Akbar”.

15 people were killed, including the deputy labor minister, when Al-Shabaab gunmen set of a suicide car bomb attack and shooting attack on a government building in the city of Mogadishu. 20 others were wounded in the attack in which 5 attackers participated.

160 Fulani Herders were killed in an attack launched on the villages, Ogossagou and Welingara near the town of Bankass. The attackers were dressed as Dozo Hunters and the attack appeared to have been ethnically motivated.
65 Afghan security forces were killed and 38 others were wounded when a group of Taliban militants attacked their posts in the Sangin District.
Two armed forces members were wounded in a bomb attack in the area of Fortul. The ELN or Farc dissidents are suspected for the attack.
Suspected Al-Qaeda gunmen blew up a security headquarter in the Shibam District using a large quantity of explosives, there were no casualties in the attack.
A policeman was killed when an IED exploded on his vehicle in a village in the Daquq district. The explosive device had been planted by ISIL/Daesh militants.

A member of University staff was killed and another one was injured in a bomb explosion in the city of Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility, but the attack was a latest of series of attacks claimed by Al-Shabaab.

15 people were killed when a car bomb exploded outside a restaurant in the capital city of Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility, but the attack bore similarity of attacks done by Al-Shabaab.

Four policemen were killed in an attack on a base in the town of Barani in the Kossi Province. The attack also resulted in major material damage and a burnt vehicle. Most of these attacks are attributed to Al-Qaeda groups.

n soldiers were killed and another was reported wounded in an attack by jihadists in southwest Aleppo
One person was killed and five others were injured, when a bus struck a roadside bomb that was carrying teachers in Manbij.
A suicide car bomb attack outside a military base, left two people dead, the attack also wounded five more. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
An IRGC member was killed and five others were injured in an attack on a paramilitary base in Nik Shahr. The Jaish-al-Adl group claimed responsibility for the attack.
i border guard was killed and another one was wounded in an attack by Islamic State militants on a security post to the southeast of AlQaim in Al Anbar Governorate
No group has claimed responsibility for the incident
Militants gunned down a deputy district governor in Sar-e Pol's Gosfandi District. The Taliban is yet to claim responsibility for the attack.

Islamic State militants launched an attack on an oil police checkpoint in the town of Buhriz, killing a policeman and wounding another one. An attack was also reported in an area nearby, but the attack was repelled and no casualties were reported.
Two security officers were killed in the Faryab Province when the Taliban attacked the security forces. The gun battle killed three Taliban and left five injured.
Three villagers were shot and killed after being kidnapped by the Islamic State in Hafta Ghar, Daquq District. The militants made a video of the attack.
i poet who criticized militias was shot and killed by two attackers in the Iraqi city of Karbala The gunmen shot the poet at least 13 times before fleeing
Two people were shot dead in an attack carried out by Maoists in Dhanora tehsil of Gadchiroli district.
Two soldiers were injured when ELN tried to assassinate the mayor of Saravena through a rigged motorbike in La Pajuila village of Arauca Department.
An alleged FARC dissident was arrested and admitted his involvement in the killing a policeman in Arauca department as well as other terrorist attacks.

n Democratic Forces in the village of Darnaj in the province of Deir ezZor The gunmen are believed to be part of insurgent cells and two alleged members of the Islamic State were arrested on a town nearby
A person was killed and three others were injured when a bomb struck a bus carrying tourists in the Balad District.
Fourteen civilians were killed in an attack on a village in the province of Yantenga; as a result, the army retaliated and reportedly killed 146 jihadists.
2019 Mogadishu bombing: A car bombing at a shopping mall in the city of Mogadishu left 11 people killed and 10 others injured. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Gunmen shot and killed a senior representative of Dubai-based harbor operator DP World Ltd, in Bosaso town. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
n Democratic Forces were found dead after being executed by a sharp tool at a water station in the town of Tayyana Deir ezzor Province The most likely perpetrators are Islamic State militants
An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to the Asayish personnel in Raqqa. The bombing left several wounded.

Three people were killed when Boko Haram three communities in the Madagali area, the militants destroyed 20 shops and 3 cars, and took away with moveable properties, including a utility van. The militants later left when a gun-battle with the army ensued in the area.
Ten people were killed and four others were injured when Taliban gunmen attacked a pro-government militia in Samangan's Dara-I-Suf District.
A Taliban attack on the province of Baghlan, left ten security personnel killed and five others wounded, with four Taliban being killed and five others wounded.
Twenty-eight security personnel were killed and twenty others were injured in a Taliban attack on a check-post in the province of Kunduz.
Five policemen were killed and three others were injured in an attack by presumed JNIM terrorists in the Oursi Department. The army launched a counteroffensive, killing 21 terrorists.

Two Afghan journalists were shot and killed by gunmen in Taluqan, the journalists worked for Radio Hamsada and were shot and killed in their radio station. Taliban and other insurgents have targeted journalists in the past.
A policeman was shot and killed by multiple gunmen in a targeted killing in the city of Jalalabad. The gunmen took the man's weapon away and the Islamic State took responsibility for the attack.
Four policemen were injured in an ambush and shooting attack on a police checkpoint in the New Valley Governorate. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

n soldiers were killed when unknown gunmen detonated an explosive device on a Syrian Army checkpoint in the Daraa province a Syrian rebel group called Popular resistance claimed responsibility for the attack and published a video
Two senior Somali officials were killed in a bomb explosion in a village located to the south of Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
several terrorists escaped with injuries in a shootout that ensued
A car bomb exploded close to a jail in Manbij; the bombing left no one killed or injured.
A public transport vehicle struck a landmine in Dagana at the commune of Haire, Douentza district, three people were killed and twelve others were left injured as a result of the bomb blast.
n soldier killed and another one injured The shelling targeted Zahra in the Aleppo province
Six soldiers were reportedly killed when Al-Shabaab launched mortars on a military base near Kismayo.
A suspected police informant was abducted and shot dead by CPI  members in Bhamragad tehsil of Gadchiroli district.
Four people including three security officers and a civilian were injured in a grenade attack targeting the officers in Imphal.
Seven people were beheaded and four others, including three girls, were kidnapped in an attack by insurgents in the village of Quiterajo in the Macomia District.
Six policemen were killed and eight others were wounded when the Taliban attacked a checkpoint in the Nimruz province. Several Taliban fighters were also killed, but the number was not specified.
A six year old boy was killed by a taxi driver with a piece of broken glass in front of his mother. The boy was killed when the taxi driver found out he was a Shia Muslim.
Three brothers were kidnapped by Islamic State militants on Thursday, and were later executed by the militants, in an area of Saladin Governorate.
Seven people were killed, when ADF rebels attacked civilians and army positions in the area of Beni in North Kivu. The militants wielded guns and machetes at the victims.
Seven civilians were killed and another one was left injured, when a landmine exploded in an area east of Salamiyah. The incident was blamed on militants who used to inhabit the area.
n soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram attack on a military base at the Ngwom village Borno State The terrorists also burnt two houses and a car and left with two army vehicles
Three security officers were injured when a bomb exploded in the Mirali tehsil. The area was cordoned and a search operation was launched to find the perpetrators.
Three Afghan soldiers were killed and nine others wounded in a Taliban attack on a base in the Sari Pul province. Three Taliban were killed and seven others were wounded in the attack.
An intelligence officer was shot and killed in Kabul by multiple gunmen. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.
n forces positions near an oilfield in the Deir ezZor province The attack was repelled with 10 assailants being killed and 2 others fleeing
A soldier and a local tribal chief were killed in Boko Haram attacks in Madagali, a gun-battle ensued in which three terrorists were also killed.
A logger was shot and killed by gunmen believed to be of Abu Sayyaf, the incident occurred in Maluso, Basilan.
Two bomb disposal officers were killed when a bomb they were trying to defuse exploded in the city of Hīt. The bomb had been planted by terrorists.
Eight policemen were killed in an insider attack in the Sargodar area of Lashkargah. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.
An Islamic State attack near the Qaradar village of Dubiz district, killed a policeman and injured two others.
Eleven people were wounded in a grenade attack on a patrol party in the city of Srinagar. Among the wounded were four civilians and seven security personnel.

2019 Kaduna State massacre: An attack on an Adara settlement named Ungwar Bardi by suspected Fulani gunmen killed 11. Reprisal attack by an Adara militia targeted settlements of the Fulani. The death toll rose to 141 a few days later with 11 Adara and 130 Fulani dying per the government. The governor spoke that the motive was to destroy specific communities. The attacks took place in Kajuru LGA of Kaduna State. Miyetti Allah was reported to have published a list of 131 dead, but later clarified that 66 Fulani were buried and 65 remain missing.
i border guard was killed and another one was wounded in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint on the outskirts of Khanaqin
Three people from the same family were killed and eleven others were injured when a mortar struck their home in the Dashti Qala District, the incident was blamed on the Taliban.
Suspected ELN guerrillas bombed the Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline in Teorama municipality of Norte de Santander Department overnight..
n army blamed on FARC dissidents
in Egypt Several other recruits were also injured in the incident
Four policemen were killed and 3 other people were injured in a shooting attack on a police vehicle by militants in Dera Ismail Khan. The Hizbul-Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.
A patrol vehicle was ambushed in the Mopti Region, killing 3 policemen and injuring 2 others, in the same day, militants shot and killed a customs officer in an area nearby.
The head of a local council in a neighborhood in Raqqa was shot and killed in the city of Raqqa by presumed Islamic State gunmen.
A Somali police officer was killed when a bomb placed in his car exploded in the Somali capital of Mogadishu.
Four people were killed when separatists gunmen set on fire a hotel and started shooting in the air in Kumba. Seven vehicles belonging to personnel of the hospital were also burnt down in the attack.
injuring three people No group has claimed responsibility yet for the incident
Maoists executed a suspected police informant in Venosh village of Nabarangpur district by slitting his throat.
n intelligence official said 200 people were kidnapped

A bomb exploded inside the  Santísimo de la Catedral of Ecatepec. The Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje group is suspected being responsible, though it has denied having any hand behind it and blamed it on another group called Conspiración del Trueno.
Four security personnel were injured when a suicide bomber targeted their convoy in the Mastung District.
Two policemen and a civilian were killed in an attack on a market in the village of Bagaji, Dogondoutchi District. The attack is suspected to have been done by Jihadists.

Three fuel vendors were killed when gunmen opened gunfire on them in the Inahare area of Menaka. Afterwards, the gunmen were chased down by security forces and a clash was caused resulting in two dead of the security forces and two dead of the gunmen. The attack is suspected to have been done by the Islamic State Greater Sahara .
i civilians were killed when a bomb exploded in the Yemeni city of Hodeidah The attack was blamed on Houthis

A car bombing targeted a Somali lawmaker, in Mogadishu, killing the driver and injuring 2 others. The lawmaker escaped the attack unscathed as he was not in the vehicle at the time. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.

An Islamic State attack on a police outpost near the Imam Weis area, in Diyala Governorate, killed a policeman and injured another. The militants also suffered an unknown number of casualties when reinforcements arrived.
i security personnel were killed when a roadside bomb struck their vehicle in the district of Al Mahfad AlQaeda was blamed for the attack

KhashZahedan suicide bombing A suicide car bomb attack on a bus carrying Iranian paramilitary revolutionary guard soldiers killed 27 soldiers and injured 13 others JaishalAdl took responsibility for the attack which took place somewhere in the Sistan and Baluchestan province

2019 Pulwama attack: 40 personnel belonging to Central Reserve Police Force  were killed when a suicide car bomber rammed an explosive laden vehicle on a convoy in the Pulwama District. Around two dozen others were also injured in the attack. Jaish-e-Mohammed claimed responsibility for the attack. Several other vehicles were damaged in the powerful blast.

Eight members of the Popular Mobilization Units , including a group leader, were killed when their convoy was struck by two roadside bombs in the province of Saladin. Seven other personnel were also injured in the bomb attacks.

ian farmer and four security officers were killed and eight others were injured when a homemade bomb exploded in the town of AlSalt Jordan An investigation found that the device was matching that of the proIslamic State terrorist cell which had attacked the area in August of 2018
A booby trapped corpse exploded, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 6 others in the area of Djibo. Most of these attacks are attributed to Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb groups.
Two soldiers were killed and four NPA rebels were killed in an NPA raid on an army detachment in the Malaybalay City.
A military intelligence officer was shot and killed by a sniper in the outskirts of Tafas, Daraa. A group named "Popular Resistance" claimed responsibility for the attack.

Nine border officers were killed and two others were wounded when the Taliban attacked their checkpoints in the Shorabak District. Sixteen Taliban were killed and nine others were injured in the ensuing clashes.

A Taliban attack on a security post in the Spinboldak District, left 32 troops dead in the post. The attack began when a Taliban attacker sneaked into the base and shot and killed an officer, afterwards a Taliban attacker rammed his explosive-laden vehicle into the base, then the attackers opened gunfire on the post once they were inside, no one in the base survived the attack. The attackers then looted the base and then fled.

Five customs officers were killed when Jihadists militants attacked the customs station in Nohao. The militants also burnt down the station and three vehicles. In the area nearby, a vehicle carrying a Spanish priest was intercepted and the priest was shot and killed by the militants.

Eight civilians were kidnapped by Islamic State militants in the province of Anbar. The first kidnapping was 5 kidnapped in the area of Rawah; the second kidnapping took place 80 kilometers west of the city of Haditha.
Three civilians and two policemen were injured when an explosive device targeted a security patrol near the al-Istiqama mosque in Giza, the attack was blamed on the Muslim Brotherhood.
A vehicle carrying MSA fighters in Talataye struck an explosive device, killing a fighter and injuring 3 others. The area often features attacks of the Al-Qaeda group JNIM.

ien soldiers were killed and six others were injured when heavily armed Boko Haram terrorists launched a raid on the army post in Chetima Wanou in the countrys southeast area Several terrorists were killed including a corpse left on the spot and 8 others terrorists were captured
3 Boko Haram suicide bombers killed 8 people and injured 15 others in Maiduguri. The terrorists also shot and the residents during the attack.

15 soldiers were killed or wounded when terrorists attacked a checkpoint in the North Sinai Province. Seven terrorists are also said to have been killed in the exchange of fire. According to medical sources, 11 soldiers were killed in the attack.
A bomb placed on a vase exploded, killing a civilian and injuring 3 others in the city of Ghazni. The attack was blamed on the Taliban.
An army officer was killed and another one was wounded in an IED blast in the Rajouri District.
Two shepherds were killed and another one was wounded when a landmine placed by Islamic State militants blew up in the Al-Nassaf area near Fallujah.
Two Frontier Corps personnel were killed and a passer by was injured in a shooting attack in Loralai. The Tehrik-i-Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.
Three civilians including a child were killed when explosives planted on their vehicle blew up in Kandahar's Daman District. No group has been blamed yet for the attack.
Abu Sayyaf fired mortars at a medical mission in Patikul Sulu, disrupting the mission. No one was hurt in the attack.
n Democratic Forces in a market in the town of Diban The SDF has accused the Islamic State of being behind similar operations
Six soldiers were injured when a military vehicle dodging bombs triggered by ELN collided with another vehicle in Palestina village in Tame municipality, located in Arauca Department.

n soldiers were killed and five others were wounded in a Boko Haram attack on a military base in Buni Yadi Yobe State Five terrorists were also killed in the attack and their equipment was seized by the soldiers

Eight policemen were killed and three others were injured when the Taliban attacked a checkpoint in Balkh's Chimtal District. The attackers also used RPGs in the attack. Several Taliban attackers were killed and wounded in the attack, but the number was not known as the Taliban evacuated their casualties.

2019 Balochistan attack :Six to Nine Frontier Corps personnel were killed and several others were injured in a shooting attack in the Turbat area of Balochistan. A group named BRAS claimed responsibility.
n soldiers were killed and six others were injured in a Boko Haram attack on an army post near the town of Banki Borno State
i civilians were shot and killed by Islamic State militants in the province of Kirkuk alRashad District
A person was killed when a magnetic explosive device exploded in the Panshir Wat area at Kabul's PD11. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
Four civilians were killed when two female suicide bombers detonated their vests near a refugee camp in the town of Bosso. The attack is believed to have been done by Boko Haram.

A roadside bomb struck a African Union armored personnel carrier in the city of Mogadishu, killing two policemen who were near the attack. No group has claimed responsibility, but Al-Shabaab often does attacks like these.
A pharmacist was shot and killed by two ISIL gunmen on a motorbike, while he was on a car wash in the center of the city of Raqqa.
i child was killed and two of his family members were wounded when a landmine placed by Islamic State blew up while they were collecting truffles in the Haditha District

n soldiers including an army major were killed in a gunfight with militants in Pulwama an army soldier was also critically wounded and three terrorists and one civilian was killed were killed in the shootout The attack was done by JaisheMohammed

is including five security personnel while gathering desert truffles in the Umm alJedaan area Anbar Province afterwards two of the kidnapped officers were later found dead The fate of the others remains unknown and a search operation has been launched
Two civilians were shot and killed in an attack by ADF militants in the town of Mavivi in North Kivu, the attackers also clashed with the army for two hours during the attack.

s Idlib killed 24 people including 4 children and injured 51 others The first bombing was a parked car who exploded while the second one was when ambulances arrived to the area a bike bomb exploded No group has claimed responsibility though both Syrian intelligence and Islamic State has been accused of such bombings in the past Hayat Tahrir alSham has blamed Russian and Assad regimes of involvement

Three policemen were killed and three other people including a woman and two policemen, when a suicide bomber detonated his explosives while surrounded by the police near the Al-Azhar Mosque in Cairo.
Eighteen firewood merchants were killed when they fell in an ambush attack by Boko Haram in the Koshebe, in Jere area.
n defense minister has stated that ELN and FARC dissidents were suspected
i border guards discovered the bodies of six people who had been kidnapped in the Najaf Governorate on Monday
Two children were killed when a bomb went off while they were playing in an area of al-Nassaf, Anbar Province.
The Chadian troops were searching for the attackers and their hostages
Two security officers were killed when Islamic State militants launched an attack on a checkpoint in the Qayyarah subdistrict. Four militants were also killed in the shootout while the rest escaped.
Six civilians were killed when a roadside bomb struck a civilian vehicle in the Qarghayi District. So far no group has been blamed for the attack or has claimed responsibility.

Four people including two civilians were killed when the Taliban opened fire on a convoy of a private company in the highway linking Jawzjan's provincial capital Shiberghan city to neighboring Mazar-e-Sharif. An official said that two Taliban militants were killed, although Aneq said that the militants took the vehicle to an unknown area.
n troops
A Somali prosecutor was shot and killed by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Hodan area of Mogadishu. The attackers then escaped with his vehicle. The group claimed responsibility.

A GATIA officer was killed on Wednesday night by gunmen in a village near the town of Ingar in the Menaka region, the attackers also wounded the victim's wife and a family member, the attackers also looted the property and fled with the victim's car.
n Democratic Forces were shot and killed by ISIL gunmen on a motorcycle in the village of alSabha in eastern Deir ezZor Province
s Hodeida

Perpetrators: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb or Islamic State
Description: A policeman was shot and killed by terrorists presumed to belong to JNIM/ISGS in the Pama-Fada axis in the province of Kompienga. The policeman was arrested and then shot and killed.
Islamic State claimed responsibility
A policeman was killed and four others were injured when gunmen opened fire on them after being stopped at a checkpoint in Rawalpindi. The Hizbul Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Six people were killed and at least 20 were wounded in two car bombings in the rebel held areas of Afrin and Jarabulus. The first attack was a car bomb in Afrin which killed a 10-year-old girl and injured 20 others. The second car bombing occurred in Jarabulus as four Turkish-backed rebels tried to defuse a car bomb and it exploded while defusing it. The attacks are believed to have been done by the YPG.

20 people were killed when a car bomb exploded near a minibus of the Kurdish self-defense force and oil workers; among the dead were also oil workers. A number of other people were also left critically injured in the attack which occurred in the town of Al-Shuhayl. The Islamic State was behind the attack.

A man's head was discovered after he went missing three days ago in the mountainous area of Sidi Bouzid province. The body is yet to be found and the person is believed to have been beheaded by ISIS militants, the Islamic State group claimed responsibility and said that the man killed was a spy, the group also claimed booby trapping the area around the body.

A caravan of workers of the oil company of Anadarko was attacked by gunmen in the Mocimboa De Praia District, resulting in the death of a contractor who was beheaded and the injuries of six people. The attack is believed to have been done by the same group doing attacks since October 2017.
Maoists attacked and burnt vehicles and construction equipment on a bridge between Lodhi and Kodwa villages of Gomia block.
Al-Shabaab attacked a Somali military base, but were repulsed. Al-Shabaab clashed with military for over an hour, leading to heavy casualties per eyewitnesses.
n army blamed on FARC dissidents
Two units of Mexibús were torched in Ecatepec. The Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje group is suspected being behind it by the police.

A person was killed and two others were injured in a bombing which occurred outside of an office of the private telecom company Ncell in the Lalitpur District. The blast had also damaged and shattered the windows of other buildings in the area nearby. No group claimed responsibility but the police arrested six people.
Four people were killed, 7 were left missing, and another one was left severely injured in a Boko Haram attack on the hamlet of Garin-Amadou, near the village of Bosso.
Five fishermen were shot dead by Islamic State militants on the banks of Lake Tharthar. Their corpses were blown up while their cars were burnt by the attackers.

n Armys 7th Division Headquarters Maimalri barracks and shelling on Teachers Village were reported killing 1 and injuring 20 The army and Bornos police commissioner however denied any attack though ISWAP claimed responsibility and also showed a video of it attacking Maiduguri airport and Nigerian military targets Three people were injured in a rocket attack in Gwoza LGA Boko Haram also clashed in Auno and attacked Zabarmari a day before
i forces who killed three attackers

n soldiers including two officers were killed in an ambush attack by the Islamic State in an area located between northeast of Palmyra and northwest of alSukhnah three soldiers were also kidnapped in the attack
A Somali lawmaker identified as Osman Elmi Boqore was shot and killed by gunmen in the city of Mogadishu. The attack was blamed on Al-Shabaab.
Boko Haram carried out series of attack on election day. The army stated they attacked Geidam, though there were no casualties. Clashes also took place in Goniri on the border with Borno.
Three soldiers were injured when a bomb placed near the wall of Golden Arrow School, exploded in the Mirali Sub division. The Hizbul Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.
s Cabo Delgado province in one attack the people were beheaded after being shot dead the attackers are believed to belong to a group called Ahlu Sunnah WaJama
In a sabotaging action on a military vehicle transporting Firqat Al-Hamzat terrorists three people died. The attack was carried out by the Afrin Liberation Forces.
A motorbike rigged with explosives exploded in Al-Sa'a square of Idlib city, killing one and injuring several others.
A person was killed and 11 were injured when an explosive laden motorbike detonated in Dera Murad Jamali.
Twelve soldiers were killed and 60 other people were injured when Houthis fired a missile at a popular market in the town of Al-Buqa, Saada Province.
No group has claimed responsibility yet
n Army were killed when a landmine exploded in the area of AlShoula south of Deir ezZor city The landmine had been placed by Islamic State militants

Two civilians were killed in a raid by members of the Allied Democratic Forces , the militants burnt homes and a health care center as well as looting shops, kiosks and animals. The incident occurred in the Mamove, Beni territory.
an troops were injured in the attack no foreign troops were injured in the attack and the AlQaeda branch in Mali JNIM claimed responsibility for the attack

Islamic State militants attacked the Sayf Saad village in Kirkuk province by firing rocket-propelled grenades at the village. Although the villagers resisted, a villager was left injured and another one was left missing and is believed to have been kidnapped by the militants.
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a bus with Turkish state allied terrorists. The vehicle was burned down. There were casualties, but it's unknown how many.
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a checkpoint of Qewat El-Nuxbe terrorists. In the clashes that broke out our people got killed.
NPA attacked and burnt a hydropower plant in Naujan, Oriental Mindoro, burning its equipment and stealing other objects.
Three members of the Popular Mobilization Forces were left injured when their vehicle struck a bomb placed by Islamic State militants in the al-Tharthar area in northern Ramadi.
Nine street cleaners were shot dead and seven others were injured when they were targeted by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Lafole area of the Lower Shabelle.
Suspected Fulani gunmen attacked several villages of Kajuru LGA, killing 29 Adara people and burning around 40 houses in a suspected retaliation for the 2019 Kaduna State massacre.

Three construction workers were killed and three others wounded when a bomb exploded near a bus carrying the construction workers in the al-Nuaimiya area near Fallujah. The bomb had been placed by Islamic State militants.
A ranger was killed and two others including a passerby were injured when a bomb hidden in grass struck their patrol in the Yala Province. The attack was blamed on "Insurgents".

Seventeen people were killed and around three others were injured when a booby trapped corpse of a man who had been kidnapped days before was found, in the Gondogourou, close to the town of Koro. The corpse exploded while the relatives were burying the man. According to a source, this is a method that jihadists use; most of attacks like these are attributed to pro Al-Qaeda groups.

Three GATIA members were killed and four others wounded in a shooting and ambush attack on a GATIA patrol in the Ndaki area of Gao Region. Gatia also claimed to have killed nine attackers and recovering six motorcycles. The attack may have been done by militants belonging to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara .

Two civilians and a policeman were injured when a magnetic bomb attached to a police pickup exploded in the city of Jalalabad. No group claimed responsibility, but the Taliban and the Islamic State are active in the province.
A policeman was killed when Islamic State militants attacked the Alas oilfield near Kirkuk. The attack, however, was mostly warded off because the militants planned to take over the field.
nArmy

Two policemen were kidnapped from a teashop by 10 armed men and then their bodies were discovered a day after in a ditch with gunshot wounds to the head and torso in the Narathiwat Province. The incident could be a retaliation from insurgents for the death of two insurgents in an area nearby in February 11.
i High Court Judge in Peshawar was injured when gunmen opened gunfire on the vehicle the driver was also injured in the attack The TehrikiTaliban claimed responsibility for the attack

Two policemen were killed and two others were injured when vehicles in a police convoy struck a mine in the Ponnagyun Township. The blasts were followed by 20 minutes of gunfire. Police blamed the attack on the Arakan Army .
i civilians were killed and four others wounded in mortar shelling by Islamic State militants in the alJadida Village south Baqubah

Two people were killed and two others were injured when gunmen hurled grenades at an internet cafe in Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility for the attack but Al-Shabaab has done attacks like these.
n soldiers were killed in an ambush and bomb attack on a Kenyan army vehicle in the region of Gedo AlShabaab claimed responsibility for the attack
The Afrin Liberation Forces carried out a sabotaging attack against Sultan Murad terrorists nearby Sînka village. Two terrorists became injured.
The Afrin Liberation Forces carried out a sabotaging attack against Firqa Tas terrorists. One terrorist was killed in the attack.
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a military vehicle with Ahrar al-Sham terrorists. The vehicle was destroyed and three people got killed.

28 February 2019 Mogadishu bombings: At least 29 people were killed and 80 others were injured when in two suicide car bomb blasts near a hotel in a busy street Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. the sound of gunfire and grenade explosions were reported in buildings near the attack and Al-Shabaab attackers are believed to be holed up in the place and a gunfight also ensued between the security forces and the attackers the next day on March 1.
Four people were killed and 26 others were injured when a car bomb exploded near the Mosul university in central Mosul. The Islamic State is believed to have been behind the attack.

A police officer was killed and two others were wounded when militants opened gunfire on the police unit in District 4 of Kandahar city. Another militant was arrested in the attack. No group claimed responsibility but the area was a former Taliban stronghold.

Four people including three soldiers and a civilian were killed and dozens of others sustained injuries when Boko Haram attacked Kardamari, headquarters of Jere Local Government. A pursuit ensued and "many" terrorists were said to have been killed.

Two soldiers were killed and two other people including a civilian were injured in an ambush and shooting attack in Datu Salibo by suspected members of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters. Another incident occurred in Cotabato where a soldier was killed, although this incident according to early investigations was due to a personal grudge.
Five policemen were killed when the Taliban stormed a security outpost in the northern Afghan province of Balkh.
Militants belonging to Tahrir-al-Sham shelled with mortars and missiles the city of Aleppo, no one was killed or injured, although damage was done to some buildings in the area.
NPA members torched heavy construction equipment in Alcala, Cagayan.
The Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline was bombed by ELN in Saravena municipality of Arauca Department.

A mass grave was found 10 days ago according to SDF's spokesman Adnan Afrin on 28 February. It contained dozens of bodies, including of men and women while heads were also found in the grave. The SDF was trying to confirm whether they were Yazidis and Islamic State members. A video of Furat FM showed a mass-grave. The outlet's executive said that most corpses were apparently shot in the head. SDF spokeswoman Lilwa Abdulla confirmed they found large number of Yazidi bodies though there was no specific number.
Two UN staff and a contractor were injured when mortars fired by Al-Shabaab landed in a UN compound in Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
The Taliban attacked security posts in the province of Ghazni, killing 3 policemen and wounding 5 others in the attack.

The Taliban attacked security checkpoints in the Sar-e Pol Province causing clashes in which 21 security forces died and 23 were wounded. A shooting also started between Islamic State militants and Afghan officers in the Nangarhar Province resulting in the deaths of 27 terrorists.
37 civilians were killed in an attack perpetrated by Dozo extremists in the Mopti region. Many houses were burnt and livestock were taken away, while several others were also injured.
n soldiers were killed when ISIL launched an attack towards an army camp in the village of AlSayyal The militants fled to the desert after the attack
8 policemen were killed and 5 others were wounded in simultaneous Taliban attacks in the Afghan provinces of Takhar and Balkh. 3 Taliban militants were also killed and 3 were wounded in the attacks.
An SPO officer was gunned down by presumed militants in a village in the Pulwama District. This attack came after 4 Jaish-e-Mohammed militants were killed in the same village two days prior.

Yirgou Massacre: 49 people were killed in both jihadist attacks and ethnic clashes caused by jihadists. The events started when a jihadist group killed 6 people. Afterward, people from the ethnic group of the Mossi retaliated against the Fulani community, committing many acts of violence in which 43 were killed. In total 49 people were killed and many were injured in both of the attacks. A total of 6,103 people are displaced. The events occurred in the area of Barsaloglo.
Four security guards were also killed in the attack and two guards were also injured in an attack claimed by the Pakistani Taliban

n soldiers and injured another one in the town of Ghadwa near Sabha The first blast was near a police station and killed 3 and injured 1 while the other suicide blast occurred after the suicide bomber was arrested in the police station No one was injured or killed in the second suicide blast ISIL is suspected of being behind the attack
n army crashed during combat with Boko Haram Two pilots and three officers died
A powerful bomb was detonated by the Taliban, near a military base in Kandahar's Maywand District, killing 5 soldiers and injuring 6 others.
mostly as advisers
19 civilians were killed and 8 others were wounded when suspected members of the National Salvation Front  launched an attack on the outskirts of Juba on Wednesday.
Militants fired rocket-propelled-grenades toward the Municipal Council Headquarters in the city of Sirte. No one was killed or injured in the attack, although some damage was done to the building.

n Democratic Forces and injured dozens of others near the town of AlSuwar in the Northern Deir ezZor province The attack began with a roadside bomb being detonated on the convoy then afterwards the militants launched the attack

In front of an office of the right-wing populist AfD in Döbeln, Saxony, a bomb exploded. Three German nationals were arrested and the terrorism department of the Police of Saxony is investigating a possible left-wing extremist motive.
The Taliban attacked a security checkpoint in the province of Baghlan with guns, and rocket-propelled grenades, killing 8 policemen and injuring 2 others.

Boko Haram ambushed an NGO convoy in the town of Banki in the Borno State, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 7 civilians. Militants opened fire indiscriminately on the convoy and seized a truck belonging to Intersos, an NGO representing the World Food Programme in the town.
Islamic State militants raided a house in Western Mosul, and killed three brothers in the house.
Three policemen were injured when the local gendarmerie brigade came under attack from armed separatist fighters in Mbelenka, a locality in the Lebialem Division.

3 soldiers were injured in a gunfight with Hizbul-Mujahideen in Tral. Three terrorists belonging to the group were also killed in the gunfight. A soldier later succumbed to his injuries bringing the death toll to 1.
Mogadishu
A soldier was killed and two others were injured when PKK militants opened fire on a security patrol in Aralik. The soldiers then retaliated, killing a militant and injuring two others.
Four police posts came under attack from the Arakan Army, killing 13 policemen and injuring 9 others in the area of the Buthidaung in the Rakhine State.
ISIL militants killed 3 members of the SDF in a shooting attack in a town in the countryside of Deir-ez-Zor. Another member of the SDF was also left wounded in the attack.
An ecoterrorist group named Individualists Tending the Wild Individualistas Tendientes a lo Salvaje claimed responsibility for the bombing
A Sikh man was shot dead by several militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Tral township.

i governments Elite Forces in Shabwa province and tribal gunmen protecting suspected Al Qaeda members resulted in the death of six soldiers and nine gunmen Another 13 soldiers and dozens of the gunmen were injured in 12 hours of fighting The clashes started when an Elite Forces battalion tried to storm the village in search of Al Qaeda suspects but were blocked by the tribal fighters
Two cops were killed and three others were wounded in a Taliban attack on Samangan's Dara-I-Suf District. A checkpost was also seized by the militants.
ELN guerrillas attacked the Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline in the village of Campo Giles, in the municipality of Tibú, in Norte de Santander.
A roadside bomb explosion in Western Anbar left 2 civilians seriously injured. Police cordoned the area to search for more explosives.

Journalist Javid Noori was killed by Taliban fighters. He was travelling on a bus with around 30 other passengers when it was stopped and searched at a Taliban roadblock. The Taliban shot him after finishing their search. "He was killed after being checked and then moved to one side,” a witness said. The Taliban later issued a formal statement announcing “the execution of an enemy officer during a control."
killed 15 officials and left 7 others injured
s Peshawar  No group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing
n Democratic Forces was killed and another one was wounded after a missile attack launched by the Islamic State in the area of AlShaafah At least two British soldiers were also wounded in the attack

An explosives expert was killed and two other policemen were injured while trying to defuse a bomb placed outside a church in the suburbs of Cairo. The incident occurred two days before Coptic Christmas. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing.

i government forces backed by the United Arab Emirates launched a security operation against AlQaeda in the Shabwah Province The operation sparked clashes in which 5 soldiers were killed and 7 AlQaeda militants were killed
Maoists shot and killed a man suspecting of being a police informant. The Maoists also burnt five vehicles, including three tractors and a road roller in Phulbani area.

s capital Mogadishu on Saturday night the latest in a series of attacks in the city by AlShabaab militant group Eyewitnesses confirmed to Radio Shabelle via phone that two men armed with pistols have shot and killed a young man and fled the crime scene before police arrived
Seven security personnel were left wounded when a bike bomb exploded in the Pishin District. Hizbul-Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack.
i was killed and eight others were injured in two bomb blasts in the oil rich province of Kirkuk The perpetrators are believed to be of the Islamic State
Two Afghan policemen on a vehicle were ambushed and killed by Taliban militants in the province of Baghlan.
5 civilians were abducted from their homes by Islamic State militants, in an area close the city of Tikrit. A search operation by security forces was launched afterwards.

Seven civilians were killed after their vehicle was stopped by insurgents in the Nangade District. The armed men opened fire on the van and made the occupants leave the van and then they beheaded the driver and killed six other people.

Abdul Aziz Bek head of the Badghis provincial council said 14 policemen and seven members of progovernment militias were killed while nine were injured A second government official Jamshid Shahabi a spokesman for the Badghis provincial governor said more than 15 Taliban militants were killed and 10 wounded in the clashes

At least six civilians were killed and eight wounded in a bomb blast in a market in the eastern province of Paktika. The Taliban left the bomb in a village square, according to provincial official Mohammad Rasoul Adel.
Three civilians including an Islamic Cleric were killed in Boko Haram attacks on communities located in the Borno State, hundreds of other villagers fled as a result of the attacks.

An Islamic State suicide bomber killed 5 people, including 4 civilians and a member of the SDF. Eight other people were also wounded. The attack occurred at a center of the Kurdish People's Protection Units  in Raqqa. The attacker first opened fire on them with a machine gun and then self detonated.
10 civilians were killed and another one was injured, when suspected ADF rebels attacked by gunfire and machetes a village in Beni, the gunmen also looted animals.
Ismail Hamed threw rocks and brandished a knife before being shot by an Arizona sheriff wounding Hamed, the man currently faces a terrorism charge.
Two soldiers were killed and several others were injured in two bomb attacks targeting military vehicles in towns close to Mogadishu, Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

Two civilians were killed and 23 other people were wounded when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded in the city of Khost, the Taliban is suspected to be behind the attack, but they did not comment on the attack.
i alQaeda branch
A young boy was killed and three other people were injured as a result of a bike bomb explosion in Raqqa. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the bombing.
Three people were killed and five were injured by the explosion of an anti-tank landmine in the province of Hama. The landmine had been left by Islamic State militants.
A suicide car bomb blast in Tikrit, killed 3 people and injured 10 others including soldiers, police officers and civilians. The Islamic State group is believed to have been behind the attack.

Officials said insurgents hanged a local resident and stole the vehicle, which was later packed with explosives. The vehicle was parked near an ad hoc security base. Two soldiers were injured. A deputy minister blamed the attack on Barisan Revolusi Nasional.
A bomb exploded near a school in the Pattani Province. Two students were injured in the blast.
Six security members were killed in a Taliban attack in Balkh's Charbolak District, the Taliban also set on fire three armored vehicles and took seven policemen hostage.
7 civilians and 3 soldiers were killed when ADF rebels attacked an army position in a village close to Beni. 2 other soldiers were left wounded in the attack.
A bomb blast in a village at Daquq killed a civilian and wounded 2 others. The Islamic State group is believed to be behind the attack.
A natural gas pipeline was bombed by militants in the Sadiqabad area. The Baloch Republican Army claimed responsibility for the bombing.
A Cano Limon pipeline was bombed twice in Antioquia province, with ELN rebels suspected. An attempted ELN attack on the office of mayor of El Bordo was prevented.
Attacks by members of the UPC militia, killed two police officers and injured another in the town of Bambari. The attacks occurred ahead of a scheduled visit by the country's president.

n man that was accused of working with the Syrian government The Algerian member of the NFL said the Syrian man smuggled members of the Syrian government out of the rebelheld areas to the town of Rahjan in northeastern Hama The beheading happened in an undisclosed area in northern Syria

A 15-year-old teenage girl was stabbed by a suspected terrorist while she was standing at a bus stop in Jerusalem’s Armon Hanatziv neighborhood. Security forces are investigating the stabbing attack. A manhunt for the terrorist began right after.

A magnetic explosive device , exploded near an oil tanker in Jalalabad. The bombing caused a huge explosion and a blaze, in which three vehicles were destroyed. The Islamic State group took responsibility for the bombing.
Gunmen set on fire some P30 million worth of two payloaders, a road roller, a transit mixer, a dump truck belonging to a construction firm in Kalamansig town.

At least 25 Taliban fighters, including a senior commander of the group, Mawlawi Badr, were killed in clashes with security forces in Chahar Bolak district in Balkh province, provincial police said. Four security force members were also killed and four others were wounded. Clashes are still ongoing.
Militants of the ISIL organization attacked a factory and set it on fire in the outskirts of Khanaqin town.

Four civil defense volunteers were shot dead by suspected militants in a school in Pattani's Yarang District. Police suspect the attack could have been done by Barisan Revolusi Nasional. Two insurgents were later killed by the police.
s Southwest The army blamed armed separatists for the attack Several separatists are said to have been neutralized and wounded
Insurgents attacked a village in Mocímboa da Praia, with machetes, killing 3 people and injuring a fourth person severely as well as burning six homes.
A local village chief was killed by Islamic State militants in Western Mosul. The victim of the attack was the chief of the Haramat village.
The militants also caused significant damage to the town most of these attacks are attributed to the AlQaeda branches of AnsarulIslam or JNIM

Taliban attacks in Kunduz killed 10 soldiers and police while 11 were wounded. 25 attackers were also killed. 16 pro-government militiamen were killed with Taliban also taking losses in Baghlan and Takhar. Six members of Afghan security forces were killed and 10 injured in Badghis.
Two policemen sustained injuries when unidentified militants attacked their vehicle with an improvised explosive device  defused two other IEDs planted at the roadside.
Amidst uproar over the McJesus statue, the Haifa Museum of Art was firebombed twice between 10 January and 11 January. A protest by local Christians on the 11th became violent.
is were killed and 25 others were injured in a car bomb blast outside a public market in the town of AlQaim The Islamic State is presumed to be behind the attack
A member of the security forces was found dead and beheaded in a market at the town of Gharanij. It is believed that the attack was perpetrated by ISIL cells.

A terrorist was shot and eliminated by alert IDF forces after attempting to carry out a stabbing attack. IDF soldiers spotted the terrorist, called to him to stop, and when the terrorist was meters away and brandishing a knife, they eliminated him. No injuries were reported among the troops.
A popular broadcaster was kidnapped by unknown gunmen. The abductors stormed his house while he was preparing for work.

Two security forces belonging to Manbij, were killed by a roadside bomb, when it had struck the vehicle it was traveling on. Another member was also injured and local sources attributed the attack to ISIL cells.

Charity workers campaigning against terrorism were targeted in an attack in Loralai. The gunmen on motorcycles opened fire on the workers, killing one and injuring four others. No group claimed responsibility but the Tehrik-i-Taliban group has claimed numerous attacks in the area in the past.
Four people were killed and six others were injured in an attack by militants on civilians near Mocimboa da Praia.

Assailants attacked a police station in the Police District 6 in the city of Herat, killing 5 people including three civilians and two policemen as well as injuring 4 others. One of the assailants were killed in the attack. The Taliban is suspected for the attack.
9 soldiers were left wounded when an IED exploded during an encounter with New People's Army rebels, in San Jorge, Samar.
A bomb explosion killed a woman and injured two children in southwestern Kirkuk.
s capital Mogadishu No group claimed responsibility but AlShabaab often does attacks like these

A policeman was shot dead by multiple gunmen on motorcycles believed to be insurgents. The attack occurred at a police station in Pattani's Khok Pho District.
Unknown gunman killed three people in Jema'a, Kaduna. One person died on the spot and the two others died the next morning in hospital.
n soldiers and civilians fled and abandoned the area the attack
An on duty cop was killed by an explosive device detonation in the Hawija District. The Islamic State group most of the times is responsible for these type of attacks.
A member of the pro-government Popular Mobilization Forces was killed in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint in Kirkuk.
s Tell Rifaat District The landmine had been placed by YPG militants
Four people were killed and 113 were left injured in a massive car bomb blast outside a building of foreign contractor in the city of Kabul. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the bombing.

Two people were wounded in a car bomb explosion outside a popular restaurant in Mogadishu. No group has claimed responsibility for the bombing, but attacks like are most of the times blamed on the Al-Shabaab group.
A roadside bomb struck a police convoy in Sinai. One person was killed and four others were seriously wounded. No group has claimed the responsibility, but Islamic State is suspected.

2019 Nairobi hotel attack: At least one suicide bomber stormed the luxury complex DusitD2 hotel in Nairobi and detonated his explosives. Several gunmen took hostages and attacked the hotel with firearms. At least 21 people were killed including a British and an American citizen, 28 other people were injured and five attackers were also killed.

A car driver was killed in Kabul's PD9, when a magnetic bomb exploded while attached to the car. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility and said that the person killed was an Afghan intelligence officer.
Four people were injured in a bomb explosion in the Lohardaga District. The bomb had been placed by the Maoists to target police officers.
Three policemen were injured in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint in the area of Khanaqin.
Two villagers were shot and killed by Maoists in the Giridih district; it is said that the Maoists believed that the villagers were police informers.

5 Afghan soldiers were killed in a Taliban attack on a mosque in Faryab's Qaysar District, afterwards, an airstrike killed 7 Taliban militants in a nearby District.
36 passengers were kidnapped by unknown gunmen. The kidnappers stole money, phones and other belongings. The next day the passengers were released. The abduction is blamed on armed separatists.
34 Tuaregs were killed in attacks by unknown gunmen in the Ménaka Region. The attacks consisted of gunmen on motorcycles opening gunfire on the Tuaregs in two villages.

A policeman was shot dead by FARC dissidents in Corinto. The attack occurred as the policeman was performing surveillance duties.

Four policemen were killed in an attack by Taliban infiltrators in the Kandahar's Panjwayi District. The infiltrators opened gunfire on the policemen, killing four and later fleeing.

Islamic militants kidnapped a christian man in the north part of the Sinai, the police later tried to rescue the man and were met with the militants which resulted in a shootout in which a militant was killed and two others were injured. and burnt two ambulance vehicles

n soldiers were killed when the soldiers were attacked by Boko Haram in the town of Gamboru According to the army the troops later decimated many terrorists including two suicide bombers and recovered many weapons

n soldiers were killed and 14 others were injured when Boko Haram attacked an army position overnight in Kamuya this village is located near the army chiefs family home Four army vehicles were seized by the terrorists and two other vehicles were destroyed

n man from the republic of Bashkortostan was detained right after the attack The woman was critically injured and was taken to the hospital The police investigate possible links to Islamist extremism According to police the suspected assailant said the attack was an act of terror and that he also intended to use a car by ramming into innocent people
A man suspected of assisting in the arrest of an Abu Sayyaf member was shot and later beheaded by suspected members of the group.

The Taliban attacked a large military convoy in Faryab's Shirin Tagab District, the attackers killed 10 soldiers and injured 5, while also taking hostage 2 soldiers. The Taliban also set on fire at least 20 armored vehicles.
Seven policemen were killed and 3 others were wounded in a Taliban attack on a checkpoint in an area outside of Kunduz city.

n troop convoy came under an attack by AlShabaab militants in the Burhakaba and began when it was struck by an IED reinforcements were sent which were was also bombed and attacked According to reports the confrontation was one of the most deadliest ever and dozens of Ethiopian troops were killed and scores more were injured although the amount of injured is unknown AlShabaab claimed 57 Ethiopian soldiers were killed Helicopters later attacked an AlShabaab base Ethiopian forces denied the reports and AlShabaab claims about the Burkhaba ambush It added that four militants were killed three soldiers and unknown number of militants were injured

15 people were killed and 20 others were wounded in a massive explosion that targeted a Tahrir-al-Sham headquarters in the city Idlib. According to reports, the cause of the explosion was due to a car bombing.

Five army rangers and two policemen were injured in bomb blasts in the provinces of Pattani and Narathiwat. The bombings are suspected to have been done by separatists.
Two Buddhist monks were shot dead and two others were injured in a militant attack on a Buddhist temple in Narathiwat's Sungai Padi district.
A person was killed, 3 were wounded, and 6 others were captured, in a Taliban attack on a wedding ceremony in Helmand's Nad Ali District.
A prominent business man was killed by suspected separatists. In a response security forces killed six suspected separatists.
ian security forces killing three They also captured a Christian criminal research expert

A woman was killed and 6 others were injured as a result of a bomb explosion that targeted a car in the city of Idlib.
A levies personnel was killed in a bomb blast in the district of Chitral in Khyber Pakthunwa.

ian peacekeepers several terrorists were also killed the attack took place in the area of Kidal

Eight police officers were killed and 10 others were injured when a suicide car bomber detonated near the governor's convoy in the area of Logar. No top officials were injured in the attack, the Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two pro-government paramilitary fighters were killed and another one was wounded in a shootout with Islamic State militants in the area of Baqubah.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked the community of Bare in the Numan Local Government Area; the militants burnt down a Catholic seminary and several other houses in the area. No one was killed in the attack.

A Boko Haram attack on a Buni Yadi base in Yobe state using suicide car bomb and gun trucks was repelled. 4 soldiers were injured and five terrorists neutralised, other militants were injured and fled the area.
Ecopetrol did not say who was responsible for the bombing although the ELN group often does attacks oil and energy infrastructure in the area

Four people were left injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a Chinese construction site near the town of Garissa. The attack was repulsed because officers were called on time and several of the attackers were wounded.
Suspected Boko Haram members ambushed and killed a motorist in the area of the Shattimari village of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.
13 people were killed in an attack launched by 3R  gunmen in the weekend at the village of Zaoro Sangou in Mambéré-Kadéï.

A series of attacks by members of the LRA occurred in the province of Haut-Uele, in one attack three bikers came under an ambush leaving one of them seriously injured, their valuables were also taken away from them, in another attack, 15 people were kidnapped and had their valuables stolen away. According to a FARDC spokesman, tracking operations resulted in 5 dead of the LRA and several others injured in the area nearby.
Armed Maoists damaged an iron ore slurry pipeline of Essar Steel with crowbars and hacksaw blades. Work in the plant had to be stopped after the incident.
an soldier was killed when presumed JNIM AlQaeda militants attacked a convoy in the area of Macina The attackers also reportedly seized a vehicle
n Democratic Forces were killed and another one was injured as a result of a bomb explosion in a village in the suburbs of Raqqa The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack

Maidan Shar attack: A defense ministry official stated that 126 security personnel were killed and around 70 others were injured, when the Taliban attacked a military checkpoint in Maidan Shar. The assault begun when an attacker rammed a vehicle full of explosives in the compound, then two other attackers stormed the compound and opened gunfire, before being killed.

n Democratic Forces were killed when a Islamic State suicide car bomber detonated targeting a US and SDF convoy near the town of AlShaddadah according to a Syrian war monitor But the Kurdish Asayish forces denied any casualties reporting only material damage No US troops were killed or injured in the attack
NPA rebels attacked a construction firm's offices in Barangay Maragondon of Real, Quezon. After taking the workers hostage, they burnt the site and some construction equipment along with trucks.

Islamic State militants attacked a checkpoint near Abu Sayda town, in Diyala Province, killing one policemen and injuring another, an Islamic State sniper also killed a policeman at a checkpoint in the Imam Weis area.

Maoists killed 3 villagers and kidnapped 5 others in the Gadchiroli district. The Maoists suspected that those killed were police informers.

A grenade was thrown at the residence of MP Arfo Aden Ibrahim. He was not home at the time of the attack, but three family members have sustained wounds. There was no claim of responsibility.
A policeman was killed and 3 others were injured in a suicide car bombing in the province of Kirkuk. The Islamic State group is in most cases behind these attacks.
n Army FSA group in Afrin Three people were killed and several others including civilians were injured in the blast

Presumed members of the ELN attacked a police patrol in Anorí, with a grenade. The grenade blast occurred near a police station and resulted in none wounded, although a vehicle was effected by the blast.
A suicide bomber was stopped from entering a mosque in Kabul. The attacker proceeded to detonate his vest and injure a person, there was no claim of responsibility from any group.
Two children were left injured in a roadside bomb explosion located to the west of Fallujah, in the province of Anbar.
A bomb disposal expert was killed and another one was injured in a roadside bombing in the Mohamnd District. Hizbul Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack.

Boko Haram attacked the village of Geidam in Yobe, killing 8 soldiers and causing injuries to multiple others, several terrorists were killed in the attack, the terrorists also looted several grocery stores and then burnt them.
n migrants the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack
Three people were killed when suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked the village of Manguirlda. The militants were trying to abduct a Western priest present in the local church.
The Taliban attacked security posts in Baqal Village at night. Two security personnel were injured. Ten Taliban militants were killed, and 13 sustained injuries.

A candidate from the APC was abducted in his house. Before the kidnapping the assailants killed a policeman. Later the kidnappers contacted with the family members of the candidate and demanded for N300M for his release.
A series of bombings struck the area of Al-Bab and the surroundings, killing 3 civilians and wounding at least 8 others. The attacks have been accused on YPG.
Three soldiers were killed by Mai-Mai militants in Uvira, after being surprised by the militants, the militants then afterwards looted the area.

Islamic State militants launched an attack against US backed SDF Forces, in which 16 people were killed, 34 Islamic State militants were killed and 21 others were arrested in the attack, which occurred in the village of Baghuz.
n embassy in Damascus No person was killed although 4 people were lightly wounded in the car bomb attack
Two people including an security officer were killed and 4 others were injured when Taliban gunmen attacked a playground in the Sayyad District.

Militants attacked a police station in the province of Yagha, the militants ransacked the area and burnt a car and 3 other vehicles. The attack comes as an state of emergency was declared in the area due to terrorist attacks, the Al-Qaeda group JNIM claimed responsibility for the attack.

3 people were killed and 2 others were injured in an ambush attack by presumed ADF rebels in the province of North Kivu, on a highway that led to the city of Beni. Four vehicles were also damaged by bullets.
Nine people including a child were injured when an explosive laden motorbike exploded as a Frontier Corps convoy was passing by in the area of Turbat. No group has claimed responsibility so far.

18 people were killed and 23 others were injured when gunmen belonging to the "Union for Peace" group, attacked a funeral ceremony in the town of Ippy, overnight on Friday.
Eight Somali soldiers were killed when their vehicle struck a roadside bomb in the area of Lower Juba. The attack was done by Al-Shabaab.
ien soldier was slightly wounded in the attack

Policemen were attacked by a gunman, in the settlement of Sernovodskoye , the shooting caused the injuries of two policemen, the policemen fired back, killing the attacker who's body was later found next to a Kalashnikov, in the forest. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Three cops and three civilians were injured when a bomb was detonated as policemen were on a patrol in the province of Yala.

Five students were kidnapped from a school in Bamenda, and two lawyers were abducted in Buea. The kidnappers were heavily armed men. The government blamed armed separatists.

A civilian and four Taliban militants were killed and 20 others were wounded when an IED exploded in a volleyball match in the Tala wa Barfak District. The Taliban was blamed for the blast.
8 people were killed and 30 others were injured when Houthis shelled a displacement camp in the area of Harad.

A university student was killed and 2 other people were injured when a magnetic bomb that was to attached to a car exploded in the city of Jalalabad. The Islamic State Khorasan Province  claimed responsibility for the attack.

Kurdish people stormed a Turkish base in Sheladize town in Derelok district. They set fire to military equipment in the base. Two Kurdish men were killed by Turkish soldiers. The attack was a protest against a Turkish bombardment in the area.

city of Edo State The state Police Commissioner said the attack is believed to have been mounted by a rival cultist group and initially alleged the dead policeman was a cultist though later retracted the comment about him after threat of a suit saying it was for the courts to decide whether he was a cultist

4 policemen and civilians were killed and 11 others were injured in bomb attacks that targeted police convoys near the town of Al-Shirqat. The Islamic State is believed to be behind the attacks.

Austin serial bombings:A series of explosions rocks Austin, Texas between March 2 and 20, 2018, mostly in Austin, Texas. In total, five package bombs exploded, killing two people and injuring another five. The suspect, 23-year-old Mark Anthony Conditt of Pflugerville, Texas, blew himself up inside his vehicle after he was pulled over by police on March 21, also injuring a police office.

At least seven rangers were injured when Muslim insurgents launched three simultaneous attacks against troops and police in Narathiwat. In the first attack, four insurgents on two motorcycles fired at a unit of policemen guarding the Joh I Rong district railway station at 4 pm. The insurgents also fired an M79 grenade against police and rangers that pursued them but no one was injured in the two firings. In the second attack, about ten insurgents fired M79 grenades at a post of rangers near the Joh I Rong Hospital, injuring seven rangers. In the third attack, insurgents detonated a homemade bomb on a roadside in Yaning village of Tambon Juab. No one was injured.

2016 shooting of Philadelphia police officer:On January 7, 2016, in West Philadelphia, in the late evening, a gunman shot Philadelphia police officer Jesse Hartnett, who was driving a marked police car. Hartnett survived, despite being shot multiple times in the left arm. He was able to get out of his car to shoot the fleeing suspect, Edward Archer. Later in the hospital, Archer claimed that he pledged allegiance to ISIL.

Garland terror attack: In an incident at a Curtis Culwell Center, a school district owned events center, two assailants opened fire outside a Mohammed art exhibit in Garland, Texas. Two gunmen drove up to the Curtis Culwell Center and opened fire on a security guard. A local policeman, providing security for the event, returned fire, killing both suspects. One security guard was injured and released from the hospital. Identity and motive of the suspects has not been identified. The American Freedom Defense Initiative hosted the art exhibit in support of freedom of speech. Guest speakers included politician Geert Wilders.

Commerce Bank Limited in Ashulia of Savar on April 21 2015 The robbery started at 3 pm when 810 people entered the bank brandishing guns According to witness reports they tried to take Tk 5 lakhs US6400 as of June 2015 while holding bank officials hostage at gunpoint However as some of the officials obstructed the robbers they were stabbed injuring 5 of which 3 succumbed to their injuries in medical careHowever at that point locals outside quickly used a nearby mosque with loudspeakers to announce the bank robbery The robbers heard the announcements and started violently fleeing the area using several rounds of shots hurling molotov cocktails and grenades This sudden outburst injured some 20 people 3 of whom died immediately after hospital admission 2 later while receiving treatment at around 830 pm and one more person on the next nightThe robbers divided and fled the scene some on foot and some on motorcycles A mob quickly formed and caught 2 robbers on one bike and another robber in another area In a mass beating of the two caught the mob killed one and hospitalised the other  who later succumbed to his injuries The police attempted to recover the robbers but this led to a clash and two police vehicles being vandalised Arrival of police backup put the situation under control and the robbers capturedA total of 9 people were either killed immediately or succumbed to injuries sustained and at least 14 others were at most injured by bulletwounds from weapons used by the robbers Interrogation of the captured robbers led to the arrest of more suspects police found that several of the robbers were members of the ABT

At least 50 New People's Army members attacked a police station in Mati, Davao Oriental. 30 Police officers on duty were able to defend the police station from attacks prompting the rebels to retreat using three vans. The Philippine Army pursued the escaping militants. A landmine was triggered killing three soldiers and injuring one. Another soldier was killed when he crossed through a NPA checkpoint. The 701st Brigade was caught up with the retreating militants and engaged in a firefight with the communist rebels killing one rebel, but sustaining two more injuries.

January 2015 Istanbul suicide bombing: A female suicide bomber detonated her explosives in front of a police station, killing one officer, wounding one officer, and killing herself in the process.

Charlie Hebdo shooting: Two heavily armed gunmen entered the Paris offices of satirical news magazine Charlie Hebdo and killed 12 people, including two police officers.

On 7 January, a few hours after the Charlie Hebdo attack, a third assailant in the attacks, Amedy Coulibaly, shot a 32-year-old man who was out jogging in Fontenay-aux-Roses, in a park next to Coulibaly's home.
